result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Lynn L. SZYDEL was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Order for Placement.   
Ordered Sealed.

Defense counsel is seeking to eliminate a paragraph from conditional release treatment plan.  Court finds the defendant was committed to DHS and approves the report in its entirety.   
Minutes.
Conditional Release Treatment Plan.
Request and Response Re: Copies of the last 4 pages of the Criminal Complaint emailed to Adult Care Consultants
Hearing on May 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Letter requesting extension in development of Conditional Release Plan.
Hearing on April 22, 2016 at 03:50 pm.
Order For Commitment.

The report has been reviewed by all parties.
Mr. Cole finds that the defendant was not able to appreciate the wrongfulness of her behavior, nor was she able to conform her behavior to the requirements of the law and that she should not be held criminally responsible for the crime.
The State and defense agree with the opinion outlined in the report.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the charge.
The Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.
The Court orders the defendant committed for a period of one (1) year and six (6) months.
The Court orders a Conditional Release Plan to be prepared and submitted to the Court within 21 days.
Conditional Release Plan hearing is set for 04-07-16 at 2:00 p.m.
